common_issues.title: Pieces OS connectivity issues across VS Code and Chrome extensions
common_issues.description: Users report various connectivity problems with Pieces OS version 11.4.2 on Windows.  VS Code extensions fail to connect, showing empty settings or errors related to custom URLs and version strings. Chrome extensions also experience connection failures and outdated plugin messages.  Potential solutions include verifying network settings, checking Pieces OS and extension versions, and ensuring proper communication between Pieces OS, VS Code, and Chrome extensions.

related_issues.title: WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
related_issues.text:
WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to use Pieces extensions in VS Code for WSL:Ubuntu. Piesces Setting window is empty, but earlier it showed two buttons Launch and Install and when you click on Install, for example, VS Code shows notification that it can't connect to Pieces OS. I tried multiple fixes I found. One is to set Custom URL for Remote environment and I tried with <Windows IP>:1000 and with NGrok forwarding of same url, both without success and I could reach both with curl. There are some errors in VS Code Developer tools related to Pieces OS extension:

Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: version is longer than 256 characters
at new it (settingsView.js:1:5120)
at UH (settingsView.js:1:9927)
at Object.tU (settingsView.js:1:10530)
at vN (settingsView.js:19:354749)

at
https://vscode-remote+wsl-002bubuntu.vscode-resource.vscode-cdn.net/home/vladan/.vscode-server/extensions/meshintelligenttechnologiesinc.pieces-vscode-2.0.6/dist/settingsView.js

and Pieces OS log shows error:

GET     [404] /assets/stream/identifiers: port:Instance of 'Future<int>': (2nd server)


Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with the Pieces desktop application, including keyboard shortcuts not working on macOS, Chrome plugin connectivity problems on Windows, and LTM repeatedly turning off on macOS.  Troubleshooting steps may include checking for software updates, restarting the application, and ensuring proper plugin versions.

bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
### Checked for Existing Issues?

Desktop Application

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS: Data Persistence, Performance Issues, and LTM Stability
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS across Windows and macOS, including incomplete data clearing after using "Clear Long Term Memory Data", performance degradation in VSCode while Pieces OS is active, and LTM repeatedly turning off.  Workarounds include manual deletion of the 'com.pieces.os' directory for data clearing and closing Pieces OS to improve VSCode performance.  A more comprehensive data clearing feature and improved LTM stability are desired.

related_issues.title: Clear Long Term Memory Data" Does Not Remove Captured Context or Workstream Activity
related_issues.text:
Clear Long Term Memory Data" Does Not Remove Captured Context or Workstream Activity
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi Pieces team 👋

I’m trying to fully reset my Pieces environment and delete all data associated with my usage. However, I noticed that clicking “Clear Long Term Memory Data” does not remove Captured Context or Workstream Activity. These still persist after performing the action.

🧪 Steps to Reproduce:
Open Pieces and go to Settings.

Click on Clear Long Term Memory Data.

Observe that Captured Context and Workstream Activity remain unchanged.

🔍 Expected Behavior:
All user-related data (including context and activity) should be removed — or at the very least, there should be options to remove these explicitly.

🛠 Temporary Workaround:
Thanks to support on Discord, I was told the only way to fully delete everything is to manually delete the following directory while Pieces is closed:

macOS — ~/Library/com.pieces.os/

Windows — C:\Users\<username>\Documents\com.pieces.os\

Linux — ~/.local/share/com.pieces.os/

Would be awesome to see this addressed either with:

A more comprehensive “Clear All Data” feature, or

Separate options to clear Captured Context and Workstream Activity

Thanks!

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.4.2 bugs on Windows
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS 11.4.2 on Windows, including memory creation failure via MCP, intermittent connection drops, VSCode performance degradation, and image pasting failures.  A fix for MCP memory creation is expected in 11.4.3. Further investigation is needed for other issues.  Users should update to 11.4.3 when available and report if issues persist.

related_issues.title: bug: create memory via mcp(resolved in next release 11.4.3)

recommendations: Prioritize resolving connectivity issues between Pieces OS, VS Code, and Chrome extensions, especially on Windows, given the high frequency and activity levels.
Address the LTM stability issues on macOS as it's causing repeated interruptions for users.
Investigate and resolve the reported performance degradation of VS Code when Pieces OS is active on Windows.
Improve the "Clear Long Term Memory Data" feature to ensure complete data removal or provide more granular control over data clearing.
Ensure keyboard shortcuts functionality on macOS.
Address the image pasting issue on Windows and the MCP memory creation failure.
Monitor the impact of Pieces OS 11.4.3 on reported issues, particularly those related to MCP and connectivity.
Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users through release notes, documentation, or support channels.
Gather more data on the specific connectivity issues users are facing, including network configurations, error messages, and OS versions, to aid in debugging and resolution.
Consider implementing automated tests to catch regressions related to connectivity, LTM stability, and keyboard shortcuts in future releases.
Analyze support tickets for trends and patterns to identify areas for improvement in the software or documentation.
Prioritize bug fixes based on frequency, activity level, and user impact.
Allocate resources to address the most common issues and improve overall user experience.
Improve error messages and logging to provide more specific information for troubleshooting.
Create dedicated documentation or FAQs for common issues and their solutions.
Collect user feedback on the effectiveness of implemented solutions and identify any remaining pain points.
Investigate the root cause of performance issues in VS Code when Pieces OS is active.
Optimize Pieces OS resource usage to minimize performance impact on other applications.
Explore alternative approaches for data clearing that are more thorough and user-friendly.
Consider adding a progress indicator or confirmation message for the "Clear Long Term Memory Data" feature.
Test keyboard shortcuts across different macOS versions and configurations.
Implement automated testing for image pasting functionality on Windows.
Verify the fix for MCP memory creation in the 11.4.3 release and ensure it addresses the reported issue.
Provide clear instructions to users on how to update to the latest version of Pieces OS and its associated plugins.
Monitor support channels for new reports related to the addressed issues and track their resolution.
Regularly review and update documentation and FAQs based on user feedback and support interactions.
Consider implementing a user feedback mechanism within the Pieces desktop application to gather insights and identify areas for improvement.
